revised_title: Chemical Composition of Fermenting Substances and Fermentation Products
tldr: The author, Robert Rigg, conducted experiments to analyze the chemical composition of various substances undergoing vinous fermentation. He discovered that sugar is not made up of carbon and water only, and during fermentation, water is decomposed. Rigg also found that alcohol and carbonic acid are not the only products of this process, and that fermented liquors have valuable qualities due to unique compounds formed during fermentation.
